block.p: Margaret Elizabeth Bozzi, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Harvey J. Bozzi Jr. of Pittsford, N.Y., was married yesterday to Gudmundur Kjaernested, a son of Mr. and Mrs. Simon I. Kjaernested of Gardabaer, Iceland. Msgr. Frank C. Wissel performed the Roman Catholic ceremony at St. Mary Church in Greenwich, Conn.
Mrs. Kjaernested, 30, and Mr. Kjaernested, 32, graduated from Babson College, where they met.

Margaret Elizabeth Bozzi, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Harvey J. Bozzi Jr. of Pittsford, N.Y., was married yesterday to Gudmundur Kjaernested, a son of Mr. and Mrs. Simon I. Kjaernested of Gardabaer, Iceland. Msgr. Frank C. Wissel performed the Roman Catholic ceremony at St. Mary Church in Greenwich, Conn.
Mrs. Kjaernested, 30, and Mr. Kjaernested, 32, graduated from Babson College, where they met.

The bride is an investment officer for the Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York, where she helps manage the museum's endowment. Her father is the president of CommSult, a marketing communications consulting firm in Pittsford. Her mother, Judith Bozzi, is the owner of Memorable Meals, a Pittsford catering company.

Mr. Kjaernested is a co-founder of TransAtlantic Lines in Greenwich, Conn., and the president of Atlantsskip in Reykjavik, Iceland, both container shipping companies. He received an M.B.A. from Columbia University. His mother, Elinborg S. Kjaernested, is the controller of the Benefits Society for the Handicapped, and his father is an accountant, both in Gardabaer.
